name: Growing up colonies and then prepping DNA

about.help: Growing up colonies and then prepping DNA was retrieved from Youtube from the channel J. Christopher Anderson, and was created on 5/15/2014.

contents.params:
After transformation and plating, colonies should appear in about 16 hours (the next day).  You now need to pick the colonies into test tubes to grow up enough bacteria for a miniprep.  In the miniprep, you extract plasmid DNA from around 2mL of cells.  The result is pure DNA that can be confirmed by sequencing. 

Depending on how many samples you have, you may wish to grow the colonies in a block rather than individual tubes.  We'll explain how to do both.  We'll show how to use the Miniprep kit to purify DNA from a small number of samples, but variant protocols can be found on youtube that employ vacuum manifolds for more samples.

Protocol: Plasmid DNA Purification using the QIAprep Spin Miniprep Kit and a Vacuum Manifold

contents.params: The classic QIAGEN bind-wash-wash-elute protocol for the QIAprep Spin Miniprep Kit involves several centrifugation steps. While guaranteeing excellent flow-through of all the wash buffers and eluates, loading spin columns into the centrifuge also requires extra handling steps. But surprisingly, you can save up to 10 minutes by doing the wash steps on a vacuum device.
